intro: Gnaphalium eggersii, commonly known as the Eggers' feathergrass, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, dry habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its slender, wiry stems and small, fluffy flowers give it a distinctive, feathery appearance. Gnaphalium eggersii is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid environments.
